GUIDE

Best AI Website Builders for Online Courses

Top AI website builders for online course creators, digital product sellers, and educators. Compare course platforms, payment processing, and student management.

Best by Course Type

Starting Out: Mixo ($9/mo)

Established: Webflow + MemberStack

Digital Products: Framer (9.5/10)

Memberships: Webflow

Best Budget: Mixo

Best Design: Framer

Most Powerful: Webflow

Best Value: Start simple, scale when needed

Recommended by Course Type

Course Creators Starting Out

Top Pick: Mixo

Affordable ($9/mo), landing pages, waitlist, simple payment integration

Also consider:

  • • Carrd (minimal)
  • • Durable (fast)

Established Course Creators

Top Pick: Webflow

Custom course area, student login, CMS for lessons, complete control

Also consider:

  • • Framer
  • • 10Web + WordPress

Digital Product Sellers

Top Pick: Framer

Modern aesthetic, product showcase, payment integration, fast

Also consider:

  • • Webflow
  • • Squarespace

Membership Sites

Top Pick: Webflow + MemberStack

Powerful CMS + membership management, recurring payments, content gating

Also consider:

  • • Squarespace + MemberSpace
  • • Custom

Essential Course Website Pages

Sales Landing Page

Key Elements: Compelling headline, Course outcome/benefits, Curriculum overview, Instructor bio, Social proof (testimonials), Pricing/enrollment CTA, FAQ section, Money-back guarantee

Priority: Critical - Primary conversion page

Course Curriculum/Modules

Key Elements: Module structure, Lesson breakdown, Duration estimates, Downloadable resources, Progress tracking, Next lesson CTA

Priority: Essential - Student experience

Instructor/About Page

Key Elements: Professional bio, Credentials/expertise, Photo, Teaching philosophy, Personal story, Social proof

Priority: Essential - Trust building

Pricing/Enrollment

Key Elements: Clear pricing tiers, Payment options, What's included, Money-back guarantee, Enrollment deadline/scarcity, Secure payment badges

Priority: Essential - Conversion driver

Student Dashboard (if platform supports)

Key Elements: Course access, Progress tracking, Resources/Downloads, Community access, Support contact

Priority: Important for student retention

Free Mini-Course/Lead Magnet

Key Elements: Value upfront, Quick wins, Upgrade to full course CTA, Email capture, Testimonials

Priority: Important for list building

Pricing Strategies for Courses

One-Time Payment

Single payment for lifetime access

Pros:

  • • Simple
  • • Immediate cash flow
  • • Perceived value

Cons:

  • • No recurring revenue
  • • Customer lifetime value limited

Best For: Signature courses, high-ticket programs

Payment Plan

Break into monthly payments

Pros:

  • • More affordable
  • • Higher conversion
  • • Same total revenue

Cons:

  • • Admin complexity
  • • Some customers default

Best For: Mid-tier courses ($200-1000)

Subscription/Membership

Recurring monthly access

Pros:

  • • Recurring revenue
  • • Higher LTV
  • • Predictable income

Cons:

  • • Churn management
  • • Ongoing content creation needed

Best For: Continuously updated content, community access

Tiered Pricing

Self-study vs premium with support

Pros:

  • • Captures different budgets
  • • Upsell path
  • • Clear value differentiation

Cons:

  • • More complex
  • • Need meaningful differences

Best For: Established courses with audience at different commitment levels

Course Tech Stack

Video Hosting

Options: Vimeo (professional, paid), YouTube (unlisted, free), Wistia (marketing features), Loom (casual, quick), Self-hosted (VdoCipher)

Recommendation: Vimeo for professional courses, YouTube for MVP

Email Marketing

Options: ConvertKit (course creators), Mailchimp (general), Beehiiv (newsletter focus), Systeme.io (all-in-one)

Recommendation: ConvertKit for segmentation and automation

Payment Processing

Options: Stripe (best for international), PayPal (familiarity), Gumroad (simple digital products), ThriveCart (advanced features)

Recommendation: Stripe for flexibility and low fees

Course Platform (when ready to migrate)

Options: Teachable (popular), Thinkific (powerful), Kajabi (all-in-one), Podia (simple), Systeme.io (affordable)

Recommendation: Start with AI builder, migrate when course generates $5k+/month

Essential for paid content

Restrict content to enrolled students only

Available in:

Drip Content

Important for retention

Release content over time, keep students engaged

Available in:

Scheduling featuresCustom development

Certificate Generation

Nice to have

Automated certificates upon course completion

Available in:

Custom integrationThird-party tools

Course Creation Tips

Start with presell

Don't build the full course first. Create landing page, presell to validate demand, build based on feedback.

Free value builds trust

Offer free mini-course or valuable content. Demonstrates teaching style, builds email list, converts better.

Clear outcomes over content volume

Sell transformation, not hours of video. What will students achieve? Focus on results.

Social proof is critical

Testimonials, case studies, before/after results. If you're new, offer free beta in exchange for testimonials.

Scarcity drives enrollments

Limited spots, enrollment deadline, bonus for early action. Create urgency without being manipulative.

Money-back guarantee reduces friction

30-day guarantee or first module risk-free. Reverses risk from buyer to seller, increases conversions.

Mobile optimization matters

Many students access on phones. Course video, materials, and navigation must work perfectly on mobile.

Community increases completion

Private community (Discord, Slack, Circle) boosts engagement and completion rates. Adds value.

Platform lock-in is real

AI builders are great for starting. Consider migration path for course delivery (Teachable, Thinkific) as you scale.

Analytics from day one

Track landing page visits, conversion rate, video completion, drop-off points. Data drives optimization.

Course websites should communicate clear outcomes, build trust through social proof, and make enrollment simple. Start with presell, build based on demand.
